tweet: It was great learning more about Martin’s Potato Chips in Thomasville and how their company is planning to grow and offer high-paying jobs in York County. pic.twitter.com/UQrT66QrvD

Yesterday, I visited a mine operated by Oldcastle Industrial Minerals near Thomasville in Jackson Township and saw the great work they do first-hand. I appreciated the tour and the opportunity to speak with these hardworking individuals from York County. pic.twitter.com/MxGIc7MrVU

Had a great time in New Freedom Borough this week! I was joined by @RepKateKlunk and other members of the @YCEAPA who organized the day. We visited @CrescentInd and discussed ongoing initiatives with community leaders. pic.twitter.com/PoUgKoMmt7

Congratulations to the community partners on the ribbon cutting for the Declaration House in Denver, PA! It will serve as a community resource hub, bringing together access to medical care, affordable housing and other community resources. pic.twitter.com/ze1MawsQzC

It was great to be with York County District Attorney @DaveSunday_ at the York Reentry Coalition event this morning. I appreciate your great work. Thanks for allowing me to update you on what's going on in Washington! pic.twitter.com/JPCCTWAqk6

I’m thankful the @McCainInstitute is calling for the revival of civility in political discourse and our daily lives. In Congress, I’m working with the bipartisan Problem Solvers Caucus and @RepDeanPhillips on immigration reform. We need more #ActsOfCivility

Had a great visit with GSM Roofing, a third-generation family-owned business. I enjoyed visiting their headquarters in Ephrata and a job site in Lititz! I appreciated the great discussion on ways to address challenging workforce issues. pic.twitter.com/AcPt4GDHwU

It was great to help Marietta receive a nearly $400,000 grant to address their flooding issue. 

“It was a bipartisan political effort from a lot of people who really showed some concern for this borough. And that was very gratifying,” Glenn Mazis said. https://lancasteronline.com/news/regional/marietta-using-grant-to-prevent-river-water-flooding/article_d98d2b4e-c43d-11e9-b861-63dcaaf77008.html …

@SuperiorRailing in New Holland is a great family-owned business with over one hundred employees. Thanks for the great discussion on how we can improve our nation’s business climate! pic.twitter.com/Z3R0aoAdCv

Did you know that L&S Sweeteners in Leola, PA processes over 500 million pounds of sugar and molasses each year? Our district sure is a sweet place to live with great companies like this! pic.twitter.com/UpkpkUG3vA
I enjoyed taking questions from members of the New Holland @Kiwanis Club at their weekly meeting to give them an update on everything happening in Washington. pic.twitter.com/f1rdhZc40H

2/2 - Harold pushed to have March 29 of each year dedicated as Vietnam Veterans Day. This legislation was signed into law by President Trump in 2017. I greatly appreciate his relentless advocacy on behalf of veterans.

1/2/ - Had great meetings this week, including York County resident Harold Redding. Harold, a retired sergeant in the United States Army who served during the Vietnam War, is dedicated to honoring those whom he served with during the war. pic.twitter.com/Dt7kDhc3b4

Earlier this week, I had the privilege of joining @RepKateKlunk and @SenMastriano to visit several businesses in Hanover throughout the day. We toured Riley Welding, Legacy Athletics, and Hanover Foods. Thanks for the great visits! pic.twitter.com/W0v0DSFCCn

THREAD - It’s been a busy month so far getting around the district! From Loganville to Lancaster, Hanover to Holtwood, I’ve enjoyed meeting and talking with great people in York and Lancaster Counties. 1/9

Was great to be with @FRC225TechFire and @SenatorKristin  on Saturday for their @FIRSTweets Capital Cup held at @DallastownSD. These brilliant students from York County are using their STEM skills in robotics and bested the competition to win the championship. Congratulations! pic.twitter.com/ie5teLsCx4

In Congress, I’m fighting for programs that would ensure American workers gain the skills they need for family-sustaining jobs. Glad to work with @SenToomey to pass the Blocking Deadly Fentanyl Imports Act. Thankful @RealDonaldTrump is addressing the importation of fentanyl from China, causing countless deaths in our community.
